Tunable.name: apply_autonomous_posture_change_cost
Tunable.description:
There are two places where a cost for changing postures is applied.
1) When there is a guaranteed SI in the sim's SI state, we test out all interactions that require a posture change.
2) Even when all interactions are inertial, we still apply a penalty for changing postures.
If this tunable is set to True, both of these conditions are applied. If it's False, neither condition is applied and the Sim will effectively ignore the posture changes with regards to autonomy. Note that the posture system will still score normally.

Tunable.name: attention_cost
Tunable.description:
The attention cost of this interaction. This models the fact that humans are notoriously bad at multi-tasking. For example, if you are really hungry but socially satisfied, then talking while eating is not necessarily the correct choice.
More specifically, the total attention cost of all SI's are summed up. This is used as the X value for the attention utility curve and a normalized value is returned. This value is multiplied to the autonomy score to get the final score. When considering a new action, the Sim will look at the score for their current state and subtract the target score. If this value is less than or equal to 0, the choice will be discarded.

Tunable.name: autonomy_can_overwrite_similar_affordance
Tunable.description: If True, autonomy will consider this affordance even if it's already running.

TunableVariant.name: autonomy_preference
TunableVariant.description: Autonomy Preference related tuning options for this super interaction. You can make a sim always use the same object, or use the tuned preference score for certain SIs.

Tunable.name: autonomy_score
Tunable.description: The amount to multiply the autonomous aop score by when the Sim prefers this object.

Tunable.name: should_clear
Tunable.description: If True, clears the preference for this object. If False, sets the preference for this object

TunableVariant.name: should_set
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not running this interaction sets an autonomy preference for the target object.

Tunable.name: autonomous
Tunable.description: Whether or not this should be set when this interaction is running autonomously.

Tunable.name: should_force
Tunable.description: If True, override any existing preference. If False, leave existing preference as is.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The preference tag associated with this interaction's ownership settings.

TunableTuple.name: use_only
TunableTuple.description:
Preference type that specifies sim should ONLY use this object, and no other sim can use it via autonomy Restriction is zone specific, so not for inventoryable objects.
There is a test in module tuning on a per preference tag to bypass the lockout.

Tunable.name: should_clear
Tunable.description: If True, clears the preference for this object. If False, sets the preference for this object

TunableVariant.name: should_set
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not running this interaction sets an autonomy preference for the target object.

Tunable.name: autonomous
Tunable.description: Whether or not this should be set when this interaction is running autonomously.

Tunable.name: should_force
Tunable.description: If True, override any existing preference. If False, leave existing preference as is.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The preference tag associated with this interaction's ownership settings.

Tunable.name: should_clear
Tunable.description: If True, clears the preference for this object. If False, sets the preference for this object

TunableVariant.name: should_set
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not running this interaction sets an autonomy preference for the target object.

Tunable.name: autonomous
Tunable.description: Whether or not this should be set when this interaction is running autonomously.

Tunable.name: should_force
Tunable.description: If True, override any existing preference. If False, leave existing preference as is.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The preference tag associated with this interaction's ownership settings.

TunableVariant.name: basic_content
TunableVariant.description: The main animation and periodic stat changes for the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: flexible_length
TunableTuple.description: Perform some content over time, with exit conditions controlling when it stops.

TunableVariant.name: allow_holster
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify an override as to whether or not this interaction allows holstering. If left unspecified, then only staging interactions will allow holstering.
For example: a one-shot interaction where the Grim Reaper dooms a Sim disallows carry. Normally, the Grim Reaper would be unable to holster his scythe. We override holstering to be allowed such that the scythe can indeed be holstered.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not holstering is explicitly allowed or not.

TunableVariant.name: allow_with_unholsterable_object
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify an override to the default behavior for this interaction when carrying an object that is tuned to be unholsterable (e.g. a toddler or a puppy).
By default: * Mixer interactions have this set to True. So, unless overridden, a mixer is allowed to execute normally when carrying an unholsterable object. The Sim will continue the carry and execute the mixer. If unchecked, the Sim will put the object down before running the mixer.
* Super interactions have this set to False. So, unless overridden, a super interaction is not allowed to execute (or will cancel the carry) when carrying an unholsterable object.
e.g. * Warm Hands at Fireplace. This is a super interaction. When carrying a toddler, for example, we want to the Sim to execute the interaction and mask the animation. So we override this value and set it to True.
* Tell Joke about Fashion. This is a mixer interaction whose animation does not read if unable to use the hands. We override this so Sims put down toddlers before running it.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not this interaction is allowed to execute when carrying an incompatible, unholsterable object.

TunableList.name: conditional_actions
TunableList.description:
A list of conditional actions for this interaction. Conditional actions are behavior, such as giving loot and canceling interaction, that trigger based upon a condition or list of conditions, e.g. time or a commodity hitting a set number.
Example behavior that can be accomplished with this: - Guarantee a Sim will play with a doll for 30 minutes. - Stop the interaction when the object breaks.

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a ExitCondition tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: conditions
TunableList.description: A list of conditions that all must be satisfied for the group to be considered satisfied.

TunableVariant.description: A condition for a single motive.

TunableTuple.name: buff_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when a Sim gains or loses a buff.

Tunable.name: buff
Tunable.description: The buff we're checking.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose buffs we're checking.

TunableEnum.name: timing
TunableEnum.description: When the condition satisfies. Choices: ON_ADD: Only check the condition on the edge of the buff being added. This will not satisfy if you have the buff when the interaction starts. ON_REMOVE: Only check the condition on the edge of the buff being removed. This will not satisfy if you do not have the buff when the interaction starts. HAS_BUFF: Check for the buff existing at any time this condition is active. This will satisfy if you have the buff when the interaction starts. NOT_HAS_BUFF: Check for the buff not existing at any time this condition is active. This will satisfy if you do not have the buff when the interaction starts.

TunableTuple.name: career_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied by career data

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: child_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that may be satisfied when a child is added or removed from a participant, or simply based on the number of children.

TunableVariant.name: condition
TunableVariant.description: The condition we want to test for.

TunableTuple.name: all_or_none
TunableTuple.description: Satisfied when we run out of slots of the specified types.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, we will satisfy when all the slots are empty. Otherwise we satisfy when all slots are filled.

TunableTuple.name: children_count
TunableTuple.description: When the number of children in the specified slot types passes the threshold, we will satisfy the condition.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold against the number of children in the specified slot types.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number of objects we expect to be in the specified slot types.

TunableTuple.name: single_child_changed
TunableTuple.description: When a child is added to the specified slot types, we will pass the test.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will check for a child removed instead of added to the slot types. Otherwise, we check for a child added to the specified slot types.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be checked for a change in children.

TunableVariant.name: slot_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will restrict the contition tests against slots in this list. Otherwise we will consider all slots.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of slot types to restrict the test against.

Tunable.description: The slot type to be tested against. This check will check to see if there is a child in the specified slot.

TunableTuple.name: constraint_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that will trigger if constraints are not met. May use custom constraints or re-use the constraints of the interaction. Only geometric constraints will be checked.

TunableVariant.name: constraints_to_use
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this condition will use custom constraints. If disabled, it will use the geometric constraints of the interaction on which this is tuned.

TunableList.name: _constraints
TunableList.description: Mapping between a participant and a set of constraints. The participant is what we check constraints against. This participant should rarely be the same as the relative participant since most constraints would have no meaning (an object is always within a radius of itself, etc).Constraints currently only supports geometry constraints.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: The relative circle geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: The relative cone geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: facing
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that requires the sim to face the object.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that creates a line of sight constraint.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_los
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a Line of Sight component will be temporarily created when constraints are needed. This should be used if the affordance requires LOS on an object that doesn't have an LOS component (i.e. a Sim needs to see another Sim WooHoo to play the jealousy reactions but Sims don't have LoS components.)

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TunableTuple.name: ocean_loc
TunableTuple.description: The circle geometry relative to the nearest ocean locator.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Select the depth for the Sim based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

TunableTuple.name: portal
TunableTuple.description: A constraint that is relative to the location of a portal.

TunableList.name: portals
TunableList.description: List of portal data to be used in this constraint.

TunableVariant.name: portal_direction
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the There and Back of the portal. This will not work properly if the portal is missing a Back and Back is specified here.

TunableVariant.name: portal_location
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the entry and exit of a portal direction.

Tunable.name: portal_type
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of portal to use for the constraint.

Tunable.name: require_position_los
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the portal location for a Position constraint. Positions where a Sim can't see the portal (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid. This value won't be used for any tuned sub constraints.

TunableVariant.name: sub_constraint
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify a specific type of constraint to create at the location of the portal.
If disabled then the constraint will just be a location constraint at the location of the portal.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The types of constraints that can be created at the location of the portal.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint that is created at the location of the portal.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: A cone constraint that is created at the location of the portal.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: sub_constraint_offset

TunableTuple.name: relative_circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint whose size is dependent on the size of the target object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

TunableVariant.name: maximum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no larger that the specified amount.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The constraint's maximum radius.

TunableVariant.name: minimum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no smaller than the specified amount.

Tunable.description: The constraint's minimum radius.

TunableVariant.name: relative_ideal_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an ideal radius relative to the constraint's radius.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Ideal radius data.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's relative ideal radius. A value of 1 would mean the ideal location is on the outskirt of the constraint; values towards 0 approach the constraint's center.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also scores to 1 instead of starting to fall off to 0 in scoring. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, any goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will all score optimially.

Tunable.name: relative_radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's radius relative to the size of the object. This is a simple multiplier applied to the area generated by the object's footprint

TunableVariant.name: backup_tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents primary spawn points with backup secondary ones.

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableVariant.description: Tags that specify the primary spawnpoints or where to get them.

TunableTuple.name: tags
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified straight out.

TunableTuple.name: university_based
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified right here (on a per university basis)

TunableList.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableList.description: University specific classroom tags.

TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the associated career interaction for a university course.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_participant
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified participant holding the id of a university course.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_reference

Tunable.name: _course_slot
Tunable.description: Course slot from which to pull the spawn point tags.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id_for_backup
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot if we fall back to the backup tags.

TunableTuple.name: terrain_material
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the terrain materials required.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableEnum.name: relative_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that constraints will be generated relative to. For performance reasons, it is best to choose a participant that won't be moving during this interaction (usually the actor) since constraints must be recalculated whenever this participant moves.

TunableTuple.name: daytime_state_change_based
TunableTuple.description: A Tunable Condition that takes into account when the day changes state (i.e. sunrise)

TunableEnum.name: _daytime
TunableEnum.description: The daytime state change (i.e. sunrise) that triggers the condition

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: The Sim who we're running this test on

TunableTuple.name: event_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied by some event

TunableEnum.name: event_to_listen_for
TunableEnum.description: Event that this exit condition should listen for

TunableTuple.name: group_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when a group size crosses the threshold.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold tested against group size.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: hidden_or_shown
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when an object is hidden or shown.

TunableList.name: hidden_flags
TunableList.description: The hidden reason we care about. If any of the flags exist as hidden reasons, we satisfy this condition. If this is empty, then we will care about any reason that would cause the object to be hidden, and expect zero flags remaining when the object is shown.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose hidden flags we are checking.

TunableEnum.name: timing
TunableEnum.description: When the condition satisfies. Choices: ON_HIDDEN: Only check the condition on the edge of the object being hidden. This will not satisfy if you are hidden when the interaction starts. ON_SHOWN: Only check the condition on the edge of the object being shown. This will not satisfy if you are not hidden when the interaction starts. IS_HIDDEN: Check that the object is hidden at any time this condition is active. This will satisfy if you are hidden when the interaction starts. NOT_HIDDEN: Check that the object is not hidden at any time this condition is active. This will satisfy if you are not hidden when the interaction starts.

TunableTuple.name: in_use_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when an object is no longer in use, optionally specifying an affordance that the user of the object must be running.

TunableVariant.name: affordance
TunableVariant.description: If specified, then the condition is satisfied if no user of the specified object is running this affordance. If unspecified, will be satisfied if object is no longer in use by any Sim.

Tunable.name: Specific_Interaction
Tunable.description: Only looking to see if this interaction is running and stopping when this interaction is no longer running

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction used to fetch the users against which the condition test is run.

TunableTuple.name: mood_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when a Sim enters a specific mood.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If enabled, this condition will satisfy when the Sim is not in this mood.

Tunable.name: mood
Tunable.description: The mood that satisfies the condition.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim whose mood we're checking against.

TunableTuple.name: object_relationship_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when a Sim reaches a specific object relationship threshold.

TunableEnum.name: object
TunableEnum.description: The object whose object relationship we're checking.

TunableEnum.name: sim
TunableEnum.description: The Sim whose object relationship we're checking.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The relationship threshold that will trigger this condition.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: rabbit_hole_based
TunableTuple.description: An exit condition for rabbithole interactions

Tunable.name: max_time
Tunable.description: Maximum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

Tunable.name: min_time
Tunable.description: Minimum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

TunableTuple.name: sim_spawn_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied when a Sim spawns in the world.

TunableEnum.name: participant_type
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

Tunable.name: absolute
Tunable.description: True = treat the threshold value as an absolute commodity value. Otherwise, it is relative to the Sim's start value.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The commodity we are gaining.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: A commodity value and comparison that defines the exit condition hits (or hit commodity.maximum).

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableVariant.name: state
TunableVariant.description: The state to check for.

TunableTuple.name: on_boundary
TunableTuple.description: Satisfy the condition when a boundary of this stat-based state is reached

TunableVariant.name: boundary
TunableVariant.description: The boundary required to be reached for the condition to be satisfied.

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: The state required to satisfy the condition

Tunable.name: on_trigger
Tunable.description: Satisfy the condition when this state is triggered.

TunableEnum.name: subject

TunableTuple.name: time_based
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum amount of time required to satisfy this condition.

Tunable.name: max_time
Tunable.description: Maximum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

Tunable.name: min_time
Tunable.description: Minimum amount of time (in sim minutes) for this condition to be satisfied.

TunableTuple.name: wakeup_time_based
TunableTuple.description: A condition that is satisfied by being close to the schedule time for the sims career

Tunable.name: hours_prior_to_schedule_start
Tunable.description: The number of hours prior to the schedule start to satisfy this condition.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableEnum.name: interaction_action
TunableEnum.description:
This controls what happens to the interaction when all the conditions are satisfied. Usages:
NO_ACTION: Interaction state does not change.
GO_INERTIAL: Interaction goes inertial.
EXIT_NATURALLY: Interaction exits successfully. Use this for cases where the Actor is considered to have successfully completed the interaction. Examples: - Use Toilet, condition on bladder motive - Jog for X minutes: condition on time - Read skill book that stops giving skill at level X, condition on skill reaching X
EXIT_CANCEL: Interaction exits as if canceled. Use this if the Actor did not successfully complete the interaction. Examples: - Object breaks. - Sim motive fails or distresses.
LOWER_PRIORITY: Only relevant if guaranteed and user- directed. A guaranteed user-directed interaction with lowered priority will still behave as if guaranteed except that other user-directed interactions in queue can cancel it. This should be used sparingly. A possible use of this: - A Sim should sleep until his natural wake-up time even if his energy maxes out sooner. This will help maintain a consistent sleep schedule, and can be accomplished with EXIT_NATURALLY conditioned on the wake-up time. But say a player queues up an interaction after sleep. As it's awkward for that interaction to sit in queue for hours after energy has maxed and it's annoying to have to watch the Sim's motives and manually cancel Sleep, queued user- directed interactions should trump Sleep after energy is maxed. This can be accomplished with LOWER_PRIORITY conditioned on max energy. (Note that while GO_INERTIAL will also make Sleep cancel when a user-directed interaction is queued, it also allows autonomy to run and possibly boot Sleep in favor of something else, which will ruin the Sim's sleep schedule.)

TunableList.name: loot_actions
TunableList.description: A list of loot actions that are given when the conditional action satisfies.

TunableEnum.name: progress_bar_action
TunableEnum.description:
This will tell the progress bar if there is any special behavior to be done with this exit condition. Usages: NO_ACTION: Progress bar will prioritize the exit conditions as it normally does.
IGNORE_CONDITION: Progress bar will not consider using this exit condition in its calculations.
FORCE_USE_CONDITION: Progress bar will use this condition ignoring if its not an exiting exit condition, this will be used to for special cases where we want to consider special conditions for tracking the progress (like on sleeping, even if energy is not an exit condition, we will use it in the calculation by forcing it with this).

TunableEnum.name: restrictions
TunableEnum.description: By default, this condition applies to all interactions. This option allows you to limit this condition to only apply if the interaction was user-directed or autonomously started.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests to see if the condition is valid.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a ExitCondition tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: animation_ref
TunableTuple.description: A looping animation reference.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance

TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: privacy

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: There is an arbitrary number of possible animation selectors, based on participation in group.

TunableList.name: groups
TunableList.description: A list of difficulty to animation mappings.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

TunableEnum.name: balloon_type
TunableEnum.description: The visual style of the balloon background. For example if it is a speech balloon or a thought balloon.

TunableVariant.name: category_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableVariant.name: show_category_icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.name: random_in_circle
TunableTuple.description: Specify a random offset within given full/partial circle/donut.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The slice of the donut/circle in degrees.

TunableVariant.name: axis
TunableVariant.description: Around which axis the position will be located.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

TunableList.description: The group the Sim must be a participant of

TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

TunableVariant.name: animation_ref_overrides
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, apply the first animation reference that passes corresponding tests, instead of the default animation reference. If none pass, then use the default animation_ref.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of animation references and test tuples.

TunableTuple.description: An animation override and test tuple.

TunableTuple.name: override
TunableTuple.description: The animation reference override to apply if the tests pass.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.
