TunableTuple.description: Specify a random offset within given full/partial circle/donut.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The slice of the donut/circle in degrees.

TunableVariant.name: axis
TunableVariant.description: Around which axis the position will be located.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

TunableList.name: group
TunableList.description: The group the Sim must be a participant of

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

TunableTuple.description: A variant of either a single icon or a category of icons. Optionally, test whether this element should be available.

TunableTuple.name: balloon_icon
TunableTuple.description: The tuning for the actual balloon icon.

TunableEnum.name: balloon_type
TunableEnum.description: The visual style of the balloon background. For example if it is a speech balloon or a thought balloon.

TunableVariant.name: category_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled balloon will display an additional category icon.

TunableVariant.name: show_category_icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: z

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: There is an arbitrary number of possible animation selectors, based on participation in group.

TunableList.name: groups
TunableList.description: A list of difficulty to animation mappings.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: debug_overlay_override
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon in debug, if present. This overlay will be placed on the balloon instead of overlay in debug only.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: The Icon that will be showed within the balloon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: overlay
Tunable.description: The overlay for the balloon, if present.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: The weight to assign to this balloon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that are run when selecting the balloon icon. If the tests do not pass then this balloon icon will not be selected.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: balloon_target
TunableList.description: Who to play balloons over relative to the interaction. Generally, balloon tuning will use either balloon_animation_target or balloon_target.

TunableVariant.name: balloon_view_offset
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the Vector3 offset from the balloon bone to the thought balloon.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the "props" field, the data inside "props" will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableList.name: props
TunableList.description: The props overrides.

TunableVariant.name: alternative_prop_definitions
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning other ways to override the prop. If none of these ways work, the tuned Definition will be used as a fallback.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Other ways to get a definition ID to override the prop.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_by_definition
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, looks for a favorite object not necessarily in the Sim's inventory.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuple to hold the favorite tag to search for and the actor ASM name.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type it will be set as the favorite.
If it does not, the tuned definition will be set instead.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description:
If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override.
If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override.
If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TdescFragTag.name: random_choice_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Objects with the favorite tag to be randomly chosen from inventory should pass these tests first.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object to create to replace the prop

Tunable.name: from_actor
Tunable.description: The actor name inside the asm to copy the state over.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time.
No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop).
Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order.
e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared.
When the last "Leash" interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableTuple.name: actor
TunableTuple.description: This key is an actor. The object is resolved given the actor name for the specified ASM.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: The literal string that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.name: parameter
TunableTuple.description: They key is a parameter. Its value is resolved given the parameter name for the specified ASM.

TunableVariant.name: actor_name
TunableVariant.description: The actor for which this parameter's value is to be used.

Tunable.name: Specified
Tunable.description: The actor name.

Tunable.name: parameter_name
Tunable.description: The parameter whose value is to be used.

TunableTuple.name: special_cases
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for special case prop overrides.

TunableVariant.name: set_baby_cloth_from_actor
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, will set the baby's outfit based on a baby that is already an actor in the asm.

TunableList.name: states_to_override
TunableList.description: A list of states that will be transferred from the specified actor to the overridden prop.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableList.name: required_slots
TunableList.description: Required slot overrides

TunableList.name: sounds
TunableList.description: The sound overrides.

TunableVariant.name: replacement_sound
TunableVariant.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: play_sound
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

TunableList.name: vfx
TunableList.description: VFX overrides for this animation. The key is the effect's actor name. Please note, this is not the name of the vfx that would normally play. This is the name of the actor in the ASM that is associated to a specific effect.

TunableTuple.name: replacement_effect
TunableTuple.description: Override data for the specified effect actor.

TunableVariant.name: callback_event_id
TunableVariant.description:
Specifies a callback xevt id we want the vfx to trigger when it fulfills a contracted duty.
For example, it can call this xevt on point-to-point vfx if the effect reaches the target event.

TunableVariant.name: effect
TunableVariant.description: Override the actual effect that is meant to be played. It can be left None to stop the effect from playing

TunableVariant.name: effect_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the effect joint of the VFX. Use this specify a different joint name to attach the effect to.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the mirrored effect.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint of the VFX. This is used in case of attractors where we want the effect to target a different place per object on the same animation

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: A fixed offset.

TunableTuple.description: The distance range relative to origin point that the generated point should be in.

Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description: An offset (rotation) in degrees, affecting where the start of the angle is. This has no effect if angle is 360 degrees.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for this animation reference override to be applied.

Tunable.name: ignore_autonomy_rules_if_user_directed
Tunable.display: Ignore Autonomy Rules If User Directed
Tunable.description: If enabled, the transition sequence will consider objects the user picked even if Sims in the interaction have conflicting autonomy rules. This only works on NPCs with invalid autonomy rules that are apart of a user directed interaction.

Tunable.name: ignore_exclude_all_compatibility
Tunable.description: If checked, this affordance will not be excluded by compatibility if it is not on the exclude list. WARNING. Please consult a GPE before checking this.

Tunable.name: ignore_group_socials
Tunable.description: Whether Sims running this SuperInteraction should ignore group socials. This lets them make more progress on this interaction while socializing.

Tunable.name: invite_in_after_interaction
Tunable.description: Checking this box will automatically invite the target Sim (if the target is a Sim) into your home as long as you are on your lot and they are not.

TunableList.name: joinable
TunableList.description: Joinable interactions for this super-interaction. A joinable interaction X means that when Sim A is running X, Sim A clicking on Sim B yields 'Ask to Join: X', whereas if Sim B is running X, Sim A clicking on Sim B yields 'Join: X'. If both cases are true, both options are yielded. If neither case is true, X is yielded.

TunableVariant.name: invite_available
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not Ask to Join is available.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Whether or not Ask to Join is available.

TunableVariant.name: loc_custom_invite_name
TunableVariant.description: Use a specified string for the Invite interaction instead of the standard invite text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Use a specified string for the Invite interaction instead of the standard invite text.

TunableVariant.name: join_affordance
TunableVariant.description: You can tune join to use a specific affordance, or to search for an affordance which provides a tuned commodity.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: The affordance that is pushed on the joining sim.

Tunable.name: commodity
Tunable.description: Commodity searched for when finding a potential join affordance.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Max radial distance an object which satisfies the tuned commodity can be from the sim being joined.

TunableVariant.name: join_available
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not Join is available.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Whether or not Join is available.

TunableVariant.name: loc_custom_join_name
TunableVariant.description: Use a specified string for the Join interaction instead of the standard join text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Use a specified string for the Join interaction instead of the standard join text.

TunableEnum.name: join_target
TunableEnum.description: This is the participant in the interaction being joined that should be target of new join interaction.

Tunable.name: link_joinable
Tunable.description: If true, the joining Sim's interaction will be cancelled if the joined Sim cancels or exits their interaction.

Tunable.name: maximum_time_to_wait_for_other_sims
Tunable.display: Maximum Time To Wait For Other Sims
Tunable.description: The number of Sim minutes to wait for other Sims in a multi-Sim interaction before giving up and canceling the interaction.

TdescFragTag.name: object_reservation_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Set of Tests that must be passed for a Sim to use an adjacent part of an object while this SI is being performed.

Tunable.name: only_available_as_rally
Tunable.description: If checked then this interaction will only be available in its rallyable form.

Tunable.name: opportunity_cost_multiplier
Tunable.description: This will be multiplied with the calculated opportunity cost of an SI when determining the cost of leaving this SI.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_change
TunableTuple.description: A structure of outfit change tunables.

TunableVariant.name: on_route_change
TunableVariant.description: An outfit change to execute on the first mobile node of the transition to this interaction.

TunableTuple.name: for_reason
TunableTuple.description: Define individual outfit changes at each of the transition points.

TunableEnum.name: on_entry
TunableEnum.description: Define the change reason to apply on entry.

TunableTuple.name: from_zone
TunableTuple.description:
The Sim is switched into the zone-specified outfit.
This tracked as a temporary outfit which does not persist.

TunableTuple.name: no_change
TunableTuple.description: Define no outfit change.

TunableVariant.name: posture_outfit_change_overrides
TunableVariant.description: A mapping of postures to outfit change entry and exit reason overrides.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A mapping of postures to outfit change entry and exit reason overrides.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: If the Sim encounters this posture during this interaction's transition sequence, the posture's outfit change reasons will be the ones specified here.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: Define what outfits the Sim is supposed to wear when entering or exiting this posture.

TunableTuple.name: for_new
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that generates a new outfit and then applies it to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Generate a new outfit in the specified category.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category for which we're creating a new outfit.

TunableTuple.name: for_reason
TunableTuple.description: Define individual outfit changes at each of the transition points.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture entry.

TunableVariant.name: on_exit
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture exit.

TunableTuple.name: for_tags
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit to apply for the duration of the OutfitChange's owner generated from the specified tags.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: The tuning for how to handle the outfit change on entry of the new context.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Contains the tags used to tune the outfit and also a preference for whether or not to automatically switch out of the tags outfit when on exit.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description:
If True then the Sim will switch out of the entry tag outfit on exit. If False then the Sim will stay in the tag outfit.
NOTE: This tuning conflicts with the On Exit tuning. If this is set to true and On Exit is enabled then an error should occur on load because you can't both switch out of the tag outfit and switch into a different tag outfit.

Tunable.name: do_spin
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will animate and perform a clothing change spin. If unchecked, the Sim will change outfits without animating.

TunableVariant.name: generator
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A helper that generates outfits for a Sim. The tunables control aspects of randomization, such as tags, weights, overrides, etc...

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description:
Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags.
If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description:
The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part.
If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_modify
TunableVariant.description: The outfit we want to generate over.

TunableTuple.name: current
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use a Sim's current outfit.

Tunable.name: restrict_to_regular
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will switch out of any non-regular outfits (and into Everyday) before applying the modification.
If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category
TunableTuple.description: OutfitVariant to use one of the Sim's outfit categories.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: Outfit Category

TunableTuple.name: special
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use special outfits.

TunableEnum.name: special_outfit_index
TunableEnum.description:
The Special outfit index to use when creating the outfit using the provided flags. There are multiple Special outfits that are indexed by the entries in the SpecialOutfitIndex enum.
GPE NOTE: If you want to add a new index you will need to add a value to SpecialOutfitIndex as well as change the values in outfit_tuning.py and OutfitTypes.h to allow for more special outfits.

TunableVariant.name: on_exit
TunableVariant.description: The clothing change that happens on exit of the current context.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of (tests, clothing change) tuples. The first entry that passes all of its tests will be used while the other entries after that one will be ignored. So the order of the list is essentially priority.

TunableTuple.description: A tuple of clothing changes and tests for whether they should happen or not.

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests to run when deciding which clothing change entry to use. All of the tests must pass in order for the item to pass.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that takes the current outfit from the specified source and applies it to the Sim, in a specified way (such as a temporary application or a permanent addition).

TunableVariant.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableVariant.description: Define how this outfit is to be applied to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: addition
TunableTuple.description: The outfit on the source is copied and added to the Sim's outfits (matching the category on the source). The Sim is then switched to it.

TunableTuple.name: temporary
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the outfit from the participant temporarily. On exit, they are returned to the previous outfit.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim or object whose current outfit is going to be temporarily applied to the Sim being affected by this change.

TunableTuple.name: from_picker
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change by retrieving the picker selection for the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Define when this outfit change happens.

TunableTuple.name: on_entry
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on entry.

TunableTuple.name: on_exit
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on exit.

TunableTuple.name: from_zone
TunableTuple.description:
The Sim is switched into the zone-specified outfit.
This tracked as a temporary outfit which does not persist.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will use the previous outfit as the on_exit outfit for this outfit change.
Has no effect for outfit changes that do not perform an on_exit change, such as on_route outfit changes.

TunableTuple.name: no_change
TunableTuple.description: Define no outfit change.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_priority
TunableVariant.description: Enable an outfit change to the sims default outfit during this interaction.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_change_reason
TunableEnum.description: Outfit Change Reason that is given a default priority.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: Priority Level of this Reason for selecting a sim's default outfit.

ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: posture_surface_slotted_object_preference
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to specify a bonus to using a particular surface based on the presences of an object in a particular slot of the surface.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description:
A tunable mapping of SlotType to goal score bonus. SlotType is the slot that must have at least one child attached to it in order to get the goal score bonus. This is used to make certain surfaces more appealing than others for the purposes of posture preference scoring. This means that higher numbers are good; the Sim will go x meters out of their way to use these objects, where x is the amound tuned.
For example, if one surface has a score of 3 and another surface has a score of 0, the surface that scores 0 will need to be more than 3 meters closer than the surface that scores 3 for the Sim to choose that surface.
Example: Let's say that a sim is going to eat something. When they look for a surface to eat on you want a surface with a placemat setting to be more desirable. To do this you would create a new entry in this mapping of SlotType slot_placematDrawing with a score of 20 or so. With this tuning, if there is a surface within 20 meters or so that has a placemat parented to the slot_placematDrawing slot the Sim will prefer to use that surface instead of the closest, most convenient, surface.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: This is a reference to the slot that must have at least one child in order for the bonus to be applied to the goal scoring.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: This is the goal score bonus that is applied if the corresponding slot has at least one child parented to it.

TunableVariant.name: posture_target_preference
TunableVariant.description:
A tunable mapping of posture tags to a goal score bonus in meters. This is used to make some objects more attractive than others for the purposes of posture preference scoring. That means that higher numbers are good; the Sim will go x meters out of their way to use these objects, where x is the amount tuned.
For example, if one object has a score of 3 and another object has a score of 0, the object that scores 0 will need to be more than 3 meters closer than the object that scores 3 for the Sim to choose it.
Example: Let's say you want to make couches more desirable for watching TV. To do this, you would create a new tag in PostureTransitionTargetPreferenceTag (found in Tuning->postures) called "ComfortableSeating". Then you would tag all appropriate objects with that tag by adding it to PosturePreferenceTagList on the object. Next, you would come in here and add a new item with a key of that tag and a value of 10 or so, which is about the size of the constraint to watch TV. Thus they will tend to use couches in the TV cone at the expense of other factors. One example downside of this is they will be less inclined to consider how centered they are in the TV cone and what direction the sofa is facing.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description:
A tunable mapping of posture tags to a goal score bonus in meters. This is used to make some objects more attractive than others for the purposes of posture preference scoring. That means that higher numbers are good; the Sim will go x meters out of their way to use these objects, where x is the amount tuned.
For example, if one object has a score of 3 and another object has a score of 0, the object that scores 0 will need to be more than 3 meters closer than the object that scores 3 for the Sim to choose it.
Example: Let's say you want to make couches more desirable for watching TV. To do this, you would create a new tag in PostureTransitionTargetPreferenceTag (found in Tuning->postures) called "ComfortableSeating". Then you would tag all appropriate objects with that tag by adding it to PosturePreferenceTagList on the object. Next, you would come in here and add a new item with a key of that tag and a value of 10 or so, which is about the size of the constraint to watch TV. Thus they will tend to use couches in the TV cone at the expense of other factors. One example downside of this is they will be less inclined to consider how centered they are in the TV cone and what direction the sofa is facing.

TunableList.name: pre_add_autonomy_commodities
TunableList.description: List, in order, of parameterized autonomy requests to run prior to adding this interaction to the Sim's SI State.

TdescFragTag.description: Commodities and StaticCommodities will be combined, so interactions must support at least one commodity from both lists.

TunableList.name: pre_run_autonomy_commodities
TunableList.description: List, in order, of parameterized autonomy requests to run prior to running this interaction but after it has been added to the Sim's SI state.

TdescFragTag.description: Commodities and StaticCommodities will be combined, so interactions must support at least one commodity from both lists.

TunableVariant.name: privacy
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this interaction requires privacy to run and will create a privacy footprint before executing.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Privacy_snippet to run if subject satisfied the specified tests.

Tunable.name: animate_shoo
Tunable.description:
If checked, Sims shooing away others from this privacy instances will play the shoo animation. If unchecked, they will just idle while Sims vacate the area.
Disabling this option should be used in cases where we have no valid shoo animation to play in the postures leading up to the privacy interaction. For example, the steamroom goes from sitIntimate to woohoo, and we don't support multiSim shoo.

TunableVariant.name: privacy_snippet
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Privacy tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: Generate a privacy region for this object

TunableList.name: additional_exit_offsets
TunableList.description: If set, adds additional exit goals to add to the satisfy shoo constraint. For most cases this isn't needed, since most privacy situations may kick a player out of a room through a door and there are few exit options. However for open-space privacy areas, default behavior (using zone's corners) can cause a Sim to always attempt to exit the privacy area in a consistent and often not optimal route, (e.g. an open cross-shaped hall with 4 ways out, with default behavior the Sim could consistently choose to exit using the same route even though other routes would yield a shorter distance out of the privacy region)

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

TunableVariant.name: embarrassed_affordance
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a specific affordance can be tuned for a Sim to play when walking into the privacy region. If disabled, the values tuned in the Privacy module tuning will be used.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will play when getting embarrassed by walking in on a privacy situation.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

TunableVariant.name: post_route_affordance
TunableVariant.description: Optionally define an interaction that will run after the Sim routes away.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will play when getting embarrassed by walking in on a privacy situation.

TunableVariant.name: privacy_cost_override
TunableVariant.description: If set, override the cost of the privacy region.

TunableList.name: privacy_violators
TunableList.description: Defines violators of privacy: currently, only SIM and VEHICLES are suppported. for example: if PrivacyViolators.SIM is false , but PrivacyViolators.VEHICLES is enabled sims need not obey privacy rules for the object at hand.

TunableVariant.name: reserved_surface_space
TunableVariant.description: If enabled privacy will generate an additional footprint around the target object surface (if routing_surface_only is enabled then this will happen on the object routable surface). This footprint will affect any Sim from routing through for the duration of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: define_blocking_area
TunableTuple.description: Reserved space and blocking options for the created footprint.

Tunable.name: allow_routing
Tunable.description: If True, then the footprint will only discourage routing, instead of blocking the whole area from being used.

TunableTuple.name: reserved_space
TunableTuple.description: Defined space to generate the Jig that will block the routable surface space..

Tunable.name: back
Tunable.description: Space to be reserved in back of the actor.

Tunable.name: front
Tunable.description: Space to be reserved in front of the actor.

Tunable.name: left
Tunable.description: Space to be reserved to the left of the actor.

Tunable.name: right
Tunable.description: Space to be reserved to the right of the actor.

Tunable.name: routing_surface_only
Tunable.description:
If this is checked, then the privacy constraint is generated on the surface defined by the interaction's target. If the interaction has no target or the target does not provide a routable surface, no privacy is generated.
Furthermore, privacy that is exclusive to routing surface will only shoo Sims that are on the routable surface.
e.g. A Sim cleaning a counter needs to shoo cats on the counter.
The default behavior is for privacy to be generated on the surface the Sim is on, and for it to apply to Sims on all surfaces.
e.g. A Sim using the toilet would shoo cats within the privacy region that happen to be on routable surfaces, such as counters.

TunableVariant.name: shoo_constraint_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, you can tune a specific radius for the shoo constraint. If disabled, the values tuned in the Privacy module tuning will be used.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The radius of the constraint a Shooed Sim will attempt to route to.

TdescFragTag.name: shoo_exempt_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Any violator who passes these tests will still be considered a violator, but ill be exempt from being shooed. i.e. A cat will get shooed when it breaks a privacy region, but cats will ignore the shoo behavior.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Any Sim who passes these tests will be allowed to violate the privacy region.

TunableVariant.name: unavailable_tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a custom tool tip to be displayed when the player tries to run an interaction on an object inside the privacy region. If disabled, the values tuned in the Privacy module tuning will be used.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Tool tip displayed when an object is not accessible due to being inside a privacy region.

TunableVariant.name: vehicle_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, vehicles that pass through this privacy region will be tested to see if the vehicle is allowed in the privacy region. Otherwise, the vehicle will always be affected by privacy. Note: The Object Routing Component specifies what happens when the drone enters a privacy region.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description: The tests that the vehicle must pass to be allowed in the privacy region. Note: The Object Routing Component specifies what happens when the drone enters a privacy region.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Privacy tuning snippet.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

Affordances provided by this Super Interaction. These affordances are available when targeting or picking the Sim running this Super Interaction.
Target defaults to the Actor Sim running this interaction. Carry Target defaults to None.

When set to True if the original affordance is canceled, the provided affordance will be as well.
If set to False then canceling the original affordance will not affect the provided affordance.

Tunable.name: unlink_if_running
Tunable.description:
If checked, the provided interaction is not canceled if the interaction it depends on is canceled after the provided interaction has already started transitioning.
This is useful if it is expected for the provided interaction to cancel the providing one (but we want to preserve the linked cancelation behavior in the queue.)
e.g.: Sit on Toddler Bed provides Tuck In. Tuck In transitions the toddler from Sit to Relax (canceling Sit). We want the Tuck In to complete once the transition has started.

TunableList.name: rallyable
TunableList.description: Interactions in this list will be generated in the Pie Menu when the Sim is in a Party with other Sims. All Sims will have an interaction pushed in order to keep the Party together.

TunableVariant.name: behavior
TunableVariant.description: Select the behavior this interaction will have with respect to members of the Sim's Party.

TunableTuple.name: push_affordance

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target

Tunable.description: If enabled, the affordance we push will preserve the preferred objects from the original interaction.

TunableTuple.description: Bring the Party along and try to solve for the specified static commodity for all members.

TunableVariant.name: pie_menu_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will use this pie menu icon on the interaction.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

Tunable.name: push_social
Tunable.description: When rallied Sims finish their transition they will push this affordance if they are no longer in a social group. e.g. If you run GoHereTogether while your Sims are in sit_intimate, sit_intimate will cancel, so we want to put them in chat at the end.

Tunable.name: rally_allow_forward
Tunable.description: If checked then we will skip testing the Sims we will rally, with the tests of this interaction.

Tunable.name: skip_interaction_test
Tunable.description: If checked then we will skip testing the Sims we will rally, with the tests of this interaction.

TunableList.name: sources
TunableList.description: A list of different rally sources that we want to offer this rally from.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: An identifying tag that determines how consecutive rallyable interactions are grouped and handled.

Tunable.name: relationship_scoring
Tunable.description: When True, factor the relationship and party size into the autonomy scoring for this interaction.

Tunable.name: relocate_main_group
Tunable.description: The Sim's main social group should be relocated to the target area of this interaction when it runs. This basically triggers rallyable-style behavior without needing complex and sometimes unwanted rallyable functionality. Ex: Card Table games do this because they already have a system of SimPicker-driven interaction pushing on the targets and trying to use rallyable would fight with that.

Tunable.name: require_shared_body_target
Tunable.description:
If checked, all Sims in this interaction will be required to share the same object as their posture's body target.
If no Sim in the interaction has a body_target valid for the others, we find a common matching body_target among all of their possible destinations.
If the target Sim already has a body_target that is valid for the others, that body_target will be used.

TunableList.name: route_events
TunableList.description: If enabled, and the sim transitions to run this interaction, it will play these route events on a route that occurs BEFORE this interaction.

TunableTuple.description: The route event and participant to play it.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant we want to play the route event.

Tunable.name: route_event
Tunable.description: The route event we want to play after the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: score_additional_sims_for_in_use
TunableVariant.display: Score Additional Sims For In Use
TunableVariant.description:
Some interactions use the transition sequence to choose which object to use for the posture target.
When this happens, the initiating Sim will choose the posture target and can check against the reservations that he/she can make.
If it is a multi-Sim interaction that requires each Sim to reserve a specific part, this can cause issues where the target Sim may attempt to use a part that is already occupied.
Enable this only for special cases where we also want to do scoring for other Sims in the interaction for additional parts when the posture target is decided.
For example, Hospital Exam bed uses an interaction to pick which exam bed to admit a patient to, and uses the transition sequence to pick the bed. When choosing the bed, we need to ensure that we check if TargetSim can reserve the Patient_Seated part in addition to the part that the doctor will stand at.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A mapping of participant to part we want to check for the ability for the participant to reserve.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The Sim we want to check a reservation for.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The part we want to check for Sim reservation.

TunableEnum.name: scoring_priority
TunableEnum.description:
The priority bucket that this interaction will be scored in. For example, if you have three interactions that all advertise to the same commodity but want to guarantee that one is ALWAYS chosen over the others, you can tune this value to HIGH. Likewise, if you want to guarantee that one or more interactions are only chosen if nothing else is available, set this to LOW.
It's important to note two things:
1) Autonomy is commodity-based. That means it will always choose a valid SI from a higher scoring commodity rather than a lower scoring commodity. This tunable is only used for bucketing SI's within a single commodity loop. That means it's possible for a LOW priority SI to be chosen over a HIGH priority SI. This will happen when the LOW priority SI's commodity out scores the other SI's commodity.
2) Under the covers, this is just a sort. There is not special meaning for these values; each one just maps to an integer which is used to sort the list of scored SI's into buckets. We choose an SI from the highest priority bucket.
The classic example of this tech is autonomous eating. A Sim should always choose to eat food that is already prepared rather than make new food. Furthermore, a sim should always choose to resume cooking food that he started rather than eat food sitting out. This is accomplished by setting the resume interactions to HIGH priority and the "make new food" interactions to LOW priority. Eating existing food, getting food from the inventory, grabbing a plate, etc. can all remain NORMAL.

TunableVariant.name: sim_affinity_posture_scoring_data
TunableVariant.description: Tunable preferences for doing this interaction nearby other Sims, for example eating together or watching TV on the same sofa.

TunableList.name: my_scoring
TunableList.description: The scoring strategies that will be applied to objects when doing posture graph solutions for this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: affinity_strategy
TunableVariant.description: The type of strategy to use when scoring other Sims.

TunableTuple.name: attract
TunableTuple.description: Score objects near other Sims more highly. This will make Sims more likely to be nearby other Sims.

TunableTuple.name: avoid
TunableTuple.description: Apply penalties to objects near other Sims. This will make Sims avoid other Sims.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_based
TunableTuple.description: Score objects near Sims based on their relationship. This strategy will make Sims more likely to be near their family members and lovers, etc.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: A scalar multiplier on the final score for each other Sim.

Tunable.name: negate_tag
Tunable.description: Negate the tag below, meaning the affinity will apply for Sims running interactions that DO NOT have the given tag. Note: has no effect when paired with ALL.

TunableEnum.name: running_interaction_tag
TunableEnum.description: A list of tags of interactions where if a Sim is running any interaction that matches any of these tags, they will get the attached affinity scoring

TunableList.name: my_tags
TunableList.description: The tags that apply to this interaction.

Tunable.name: sim_affinity_use_current_position_for_none
Tunable.display: Sim Affinity Use Current Position For None
Tunable.description: If checked, destinations with a None body target will use the sims current location when determining position for sim affinity scoring If unchecked, sim affinity scoring will be ignored for postures with no body target. This option should only be checked for interactions that are very unlikely to have geometry constraints for @None postures.

TunableVariant.name: social_geometry_override
TunableVariant.description: The special geometry override for socialization in this super interaction. This defines where the Sim's attention is focused and informs the social positioning system where each Sim should stand to look most natural when interacting. Ex: we override the social geometry for a Sim who is bartending to be a wider cone and be in front of the bar instead of embedded within the bar. This encourages Sims to stand on the customer-side of the bar to socialize with this Sim instead of coming around the back.

TunableTuple.name: focal_point
TunableTuple.description: Focal point when socializing in this super interaction, relative to Sim.

TunableList.description: Social space for this super interaction

Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

Tunable.name: subaction_selection_weight
Tunable.description: The weight for selecting subactions from this super affordance. A higher weight means the Sim will tend to run mixers provided by this SI more often.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_compatibility
TunableVariant.description:
The filter of SuperInteractions that will be allowed to run at the same time as this interaction, if possible. By default, include all interactions which means compatibility will be determined by posture requirements. When needed, add specific interactions to the blacklist when they don't make sense to multitask with this or the gameplay is not desired. When creating an interaction that should generally not multitask, like motive failure, switch variant to exclude_all.
Note: Some interactions will not be exempted from exclude all. This is because those interactions are specifically tuned to 'ignore exclude all compatibility'. If you would like to exclude one of those interactions, it must be explicitly added to the exception items list under exclude all or the blacklist under allow all. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.)

TdescFragTag.name: literal
TdescFragTag.description: An affordance filter.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: super_affordance_klobberers
TunableVariant.description: The filter of SuperInteractions that this interaction can clobber even if they are still guaranteed. Use this for interactions where we commonly want to transition to another interaction without waiting, for example bed_BeIntimate needs to cancel sim_chat to run, but we don't want to wait for sim_chat to go inertial. Remember that this should generally default to exclude_all and you want to call out the interactions that can be clobbered in the whitelist of exclude_all; interactions that pass the filter will be clobbered.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

TunableEnum.description: The participant to which to apply this filter.

Tunable.name: posture_type

TunableVariant.name: test_disallow_while_running
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, interactions set must not be in the sim's si state (running section of the queue) for this interaction to be available.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: If enabled, interactions set must not be in the sim's si state (running section of the queue) for this interaction to be available.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: List of affordance to check. If sim has any of the affordances in the si state then this interaction will not be available.

TunableVariant.name: tested_posture_target_preferences
TunableVariant.description: A tunable mapping of posture tags to a tested goal score bonus in meters. Please see Posture Target Preference tuning for more information about what these tags/scores do.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A tunable mapping of posture tags to a tested goal score bonus in meters. Please see Posture Target Preference tuning for more information about what these tags/scores do.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A tunable that sums values based on tests.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifiers are applied.

TunableList.name: modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of modifiers to add to Base Value.

Tunable.description: The value to apply add to Base Value if the associated tests pass. Can be negative

TunableList.name: transition_asm_params
TunableList.description:
A list of param name, param value tuples that get passed to ASMs when doing a posture transition, including routes. They can influence posture state machines and clothing changes.
NOTE: These can only be enum types in the ASM. If your params are not working, check the type in the ASM and inform your animation partner if they are not enums.

Tunable.name: param_name
Tunable.description: The name of the parameter to override in the transition ASM. This is typically used if a posture ASM needs different VFX to play based on some parameter than the SI can provide.

Tunable.name: param_value
Tunable.description: The value to set the provided parameter.

TunableList.name: transition_global_asm_params
TunableList.description: These params function similarly to 'Transition Asm Params' except that they are not limited to the asm of this interaction. This tuning should be used in cases where a simultaneous or continuation interaction needs to set a parameter on the asm of a different interaction running on the same sim.

Tunable.name: param_name
Tunable.description: The name of the parameter to override in the transition ASM. This is typically used if a posture ASM needs different VFX to play based on some parameter than the SI can provide.

Tunable.name: param_value
Tunable.description: The value to set the provided parameter.

Tunable.name: use_best_scoring_aop
Tunable.description: If checked, autonomy will always use the best scoring aop when there are similar aops. For example, checking this on view_painting will cause only the best scoring painting to be considered. If you uncheck this for painting, autonomy will consider all paintings, but will use the best scoring painting when scoring against other aops. In other words, if you uncheck this for view_painting and have 10,000 paintings on the lot, the Sim will consider those paintings, but it won't skew the probability.

TunableVariant.name: waiting_line
TunableVariant.description: Enable a waiting line for sims wanting to use this object.

Tunable.name: allow_line_on_same_target
Tunable.description: If checked the interaction will consider using the same target to go in line again. This is for cases like the slippy slide where the sim will queue up again after using the object.

TunableVariant.name: autonomous_waiting_line_prefence_curve
TunableVariant.description: Tune how autonomy scores interactions with waiting lines.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A curve that maps the number of sims in a waiting line for this interaction to an autonomy score multiplier for this interaction.
Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: weight

TunableTuple.name: line_cone
TunableTuple.description: A cone describing how subsequent sims line up. A cone position at the intended position of the sim in front of us in the line. This constraint will ensure an organic looking line. *Note: do not alter the position of the cone.

Tunable.name: angle
