Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

Tunable.name: line_head_angle
Tunable.description: The Sim at the head of the line will stand facing this angle, relative to the target's orientation.

TunableTuple.name: line_head_los_constraint
TunableTuple.description: The Line of Sight constraint for a sim standing at line's head and viewing the interaction target.

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: " The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TunableTuple.name: line_head_position
TunableTuple.description: The Sim at the head of the line will stand in a cone positioned at this point relative to the object.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableVariant.name: line_origin_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the origin of the line will be built around the subroot specified instead of the root of the object.

Tunable.name: specify_subroot
Tunable.description: Integer value of the subroot index.

TunableVariant.name: line_update_timing
TunableVariant.description: Timing for when to notify the next sim in line that they can go.

TunableVariant.name: route_near_affordance_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a reference to an interaction used for getting Sims to route closer to the target before running the wait in line interaction. If disabled, the sim will run the default "route nearby affordance" specified in interactions.utils.line_utils module tuning.

Tunable.name: route_nearby_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of a circle constraint that forces the sim to route-near the line-head or the last sim in line before actually entering the line.

Tunable.name: use_origin_override_for_constraints
Tunable.description: If enabled, generate the line constraints relative to the tuned line origin override. If disabled, generate constraints relative to the object root.

TunableVariant.name: wait_for_continuations
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the waiting line will not move forward until the sim in front finishes their continuation chain.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of interactions that are considered to be the last step in the interaction chain. These interactions will register stand slot released callbacks to remove the sim from the line and push the next sim to consider using the line target.

Tunable.name: wait_in_line_with_picked_sims
Tunable.display: Wait In Line With Picked Sims
Tunable.description: If enabled, the interaction will start a WaitInLineTogetherSituation to emulate the visual of picked sims waiting in line together with the actor.

Tunable.name: waiting_line_interaction
Tunable.description: An affordance for waiting in-line.

Tunable.name: waiting_line_key
Tunable.description: A key for distinguishing different lines on the same target.

TunableVariant.name: walk_style
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify a walkstyle override to apply to the Sim during the interaction's transition route and execution.
e.g.: If Sims were to run to everything they repair, the repari interaction would tuned this to the Run walkstyle.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the walkstyle. Higher priority walkstyles will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

Tunable.name: walkstyle
Tunable.description: The locomotion resource (i.e. walkstyle) to request. Depending on the tuned priority and other requests active on the Sim, this may or may not apply immediately.
